text.meeting_minutes:
Overall Focus of the Conversation
The conversation primarily focuses on planning and coordinating various upcoming events, meetings, and initiatives related to technology, manufacturing, and innovation. It includes discussions on logistics, RSVPs, and participation details for these events.
Identified Speakers and Roles
Speaker-1: Participant from Cal Baptist University
Speaker-2: Nathan Stewart, likely a coordinator or lead for the call
Speaker-3: Troy Clark, involved in Empire Tech Bridge
Speaker-4: Christine Fernandez, from Future Labs and Fed Tech team
Speaker-5: Unidentified participant
Speaker-6: Unidentified participant
Speaker-7: Unidentified participant
Summary of Relevant Details
National Front Updates
Speaker-2: 
  - Mentioned upcoming events: quarterly temperature review, Naval X program review, and a Dina demo on the 24th.
  - The Dina demo will be off-book due to time constraints.
Future Labs Updates
Speaker-3:
  - Announced an in-person additive manufacturing roundtable next week in collaboration with Sid Rao from Sylvia, an advanced manufacturing company in the Bay Area.
  - No RSVPs received through the Google form yet.
Concerns and Actions
Speaker-4:
  - Expressed concern about the lack of RSVPs and suggested reaching out to local companies in the additive manufacturing sector.
  - Mentioned a report being run to identify local companies for outreach.
Event Coordination
Speaker-2:
  - Suggested turning the event into a roundtable between Solidion and NSWC Corona SMEs if external participation is low.
  - Requested proactive management of RSVPs and base access forms for attendees.
Additional Participants and Invitations
Speaker-1:
  - Mentioned that Phil hopes to attend the meeting and requested a lab tour.
Speaker-3:
  - Suggested inviting Kevin Bass and Martin Mccleckner to the event.
  - Discussed a meeting with San Marino County Supervisor Kurt Hagman and the possibility of Riverside County designating April as innovation month again.
Social Media and Outreach
Speaker-3:
  - Reported 35 followers on LinkedIn and slower growth on Facebook.
Quarterly Meeting Participation
Speaker-4:
  - Inquired about the possibility of remote participation for the quarterly meeting.
Manufacturing Event Updates
Speaker-4:
  - Mentioned new dates for a primer and updates for Igniter and Start Studio programs.
  - Reported over 40 applicants for the program, with 30 strong candidates.
  - Shared insights from the Stanford Defcon conference about the defense startup space.
Event Logistics and Planning
Speaker-3:
  - Discussed logistics for a December event, including setting up for 75-80 participants and managing parking.
  - Suggested involving UCR for marketing outreach.
Additional Coordination
Speaker-2:
  - Clarified the nature of the December event as a Navy-wide coordinated outreach effort.
  - Requested confirmation of attendees for base access forms.
Scheduling and Availability
Speaker-2:
  - Mentioned extensive travel plans, making availability limited.
  - Suggested scheduling meetings for the week of November 11th.
Closing Remarks
Speaker-2:
  - Concluded the meeting and wished everyone a great extended weekend.

This summary captures the key points and details discussed in the conversation, providing a clear overview of the planning and coordination efforts for upcoming events and initiatives.
text.recommendations:
Action Items
For Speaker-2 (Nathan Stewart)
Coordinate Dina Demo:
   - Finalize the agenda and send out invitations to interested participants.
   - Resource: https://www.secnav.navy.mil/agility/Pages/default.aspx

Manage RSVPs and Base Access Forms:
   - Confirm attendees for the additive manufacturing roundtable.
   - Ensure base access forms are completed and submitted.
   - Resource: https://www.defense.gov/Resources/

Invite Kevin Bass and Martin Mccleckner:
   - Extend invitations to Kevin Bass and Martin Mccleckner for the upcoming events.
   - Resource: https://www.linkedin.com/ for professional networking.

Coordinate with UCR for Marketing:
   - Collaborate with UCR to utilize their marketing list for event promotion.
   - Resource: https://techpartnerships.ucr.edu/

Schedule Meetings:
   - Plan meetings for the week of November 11th, considering travel schedules.
   - Resource: https://calendar.google.com/ for scheduling.
For Speaker-3 (Troy Clark)
Reach Out to Sid Rao:
   - Confirm attendance and details for Sid Rao and any additional participants.
   - Resource: https://www.sylvia.com/

Prepare Logistics for December Event:
   - Finalize the layout and logistics for the December event.
   - Coordinate parking and shuttle services.
   - Resource: https://www.eventbrite.com/blog/event-planning-checklist-ds00/

Social Media Outreach:
   - Continue to grow social media presence on LinkedIn and Facebook.
   - Resource: https://business.linkedin.com/marketing-solutions and https://www.facebook.com/business
For Speaker-4 (Christine Fernandez)
Outreach to Local Companies:
   - Utilize the report on local companies in the additive manufacturing sector to increase event participation.
   - Resource: https://www.yellowpages.com/

Follow Up on Remote Participation for Quarterly Meeting:
   - Confirm if a virtual option is available for the quarterly meeting.
   - Resource: https://zoom.us/

Coordinate with Tulsi for Manufacturing Event:
   - Confirm participation and include additional relevant participants like Chris Arrow and Gordon Born.
   - Resource: https://www.cmtc.com/
For Speaker-1 (Cal Baptist University Representative)
Prepare for Tech Bridge Presentation:
   - Finalize the presentation for the Tech Bridge event at the end of the month.
   - Resource: https://www.secnav.navy.mil/agility/Pages/techbridges.aspx

Coordinate Lab Tour for Phil:
   - Arrange a lab tour for Phil, ensuring the lab is presentable despite equipment in boxes.
   - Resource: https://www.labmanager.com/leadership-and-staffing/2018/07/how-to-give-a-lab-tour
Recommended Resources for Further Knowledge
Event Planning and Management:
   - https://www.eventbrite.com/blog/
   - https://www.amazon.com/Meeting-Event-Planning-Dummies-Allen/dp/1118591127

Additive Manufacturing:
   - https://www.additivemanufacturing.media/
   - https://3dprintingindustry.com/

Innovation and Technology Partnerships:
   - https://hbr.org/topic/innovation
   - https://www.technologyreview.com/

Social Media Marketing:
   - https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-marketing
   - https://blog.hootsuite.com/social-media-marketing-strategy/

By following these action items and utilizing the recommended resources, participants can effectively follow up on the meeting and deepen their knowledge in relevant areas.

Overall Focus of the Conversation

markdown.meeting_minutes:
### Overall Focus of the Conversation
The conversation primarily focuses on planning and coordinating various upcoming events, meetings, and initiatives related to technology, manufacturing, and innovation. It includes discussions on logistics, RSVPs, and participation details for these events.

### Identified Speakers and Roles
- **Speaker-1**: Participant from Cal Baptist University
- **Speaker-2**: Nathan Stewart, likely a coordinator or lead for the call
- **Speaker-3**: Troy Clark, involved in Empire Tech Bridge
- **Speaker-4**: Christine Fernandez, from Future Labs and Fed Tech team
- **Speaker-5**: Unidentified participant
- **Speaker-6**: Unidentified participant
- **Speaker-7**: Unidentified participant

### Summary of Relevant Details

#### National Front Updates
- **Speaker-2**: 
  - Mentioned upcoming events: quarterly temperature review, Naval X program review, and a Dina demo on the 24th.
  - The Dina demo will be off-book due to time constraints.

#### Future Labs Updates
- **Speaker-3**:
  - Announced an in-person additive manufacturing roundtable next week in collaboration with Sid Rao from Sylvia, an advanced manufacturing company in the Bay Area.
  - No RSVPs received through the Google form yet.

#### Concerns and Actions
- **Speaker-4**:
  - Expressed concern about the lack of RSVPs and suggested reaching out to local companies in the additive manufacturing sector.
  - Mentioned a report being run to identify local companies for outreach.

#### Event Coordination
- **Speaker-2**:
  - Suggested turning the event into a roundtable between Solidion and NSWC Corona SMEs if external participation is low.
  - Requested proactive management of RSVPs and base access forms for attendees.

#### Additional Participants and Invitations
- **Speaker-1**:
  - Mentioned that Phil hopes to attend the meeting and requested a lab tour.
- **Speaker-3**:
  - Suggested inviting Kevin Bass and Martin Mccleckner to the event.
  - Discussed a meeting with San Marino County Supervisor Kurt Hagman and the possibility of Riverside County designating April as innovation month again.

#### Social Media and Outreach
- **Speaker-3**:
  - Reported 35 followers on LinkedIn and slower growth on Facebook.

#### Quarterly Meeting Participation
- **Speaker-4**:
  - Inquired about the possibility of remote participation for the quarterly meeting.

#### Manufacturing Event Updates
- **Speaker-4**:
  - Mentioned new dates for a primer and updates for Igniter and Start Studio programs.
  - Reported over 40 applicants for the program, with 30 strong candidates.
  - Shared insights from the Stanford Defcon conference about the defense startup space.

#### Event Logistics and Planning
- **Speaker-3**:
  - Discussed logistics for a December event, including setting up for 75-80 participants and managing parking.
  - Suggested involving UCR for marketing outreach.

#### Additional Coordination
- **Speaker-2**:
  - Clarified the nature of the December event as a Navy-wide coordinated outreach effort.
  - Requested confirmation of attendees for base access forms.

#### Scheduling and Availability
- **Speaker-2**:
  - Mentioned extensive travel plans, making availability limited.
  - Suggested scheduling meetings for the week of November 11th.

#### Closing Remarks
- **Speaker-2**:
  - Concluded the meeting and wished everyone a great extended weekend.

This summary captures the key points and details discussed in the conversation, providing a clear overview of the planning and coordination efforts for upcoming events and initiatives.
